Ankita Sen

Hans-Sachs-Ring 5 507, Neckarau-west, Mannheim 68199, Germany ·

I am a master's student in Electrical Engineering at the University of Stuttgart, I have been an exchange student at the Tokyo Institute of Technology. I am passionate about Machine learning, Deep learning, Computer Vision, and AI, aiming to conduct research that advances these fields.

Publications

A Novel Curve Scanning Based Maximum Power Point Tracking Algorithm Under Partial Shading Conditions

A. Sen, S. Pradhan and A. Kumar, "A Novel Curve Scanning Based Maximum Power Point Tracking Algorithm Under Partial Shading Conditions," 2020 IEEE First International Conference on Smart Technologies for Power, Energy and Control (STPEC), Nagpur, India, 2020, pp. 1-6, doi: 10.1109/STPEC49749.2020.9297794. keywords: {Photovoltaic systems;Switches;Maximum power point trackers;DC-DC power converters;Classification algorithms;Tracking loops;Tracking;Maximum Power Point (MPP);Global Maximum Power Point (GMPP);Local Maximum Power Point (LMPP);Partial Shading Condition (PSC);Uniform Irradiance Condition (UIC);Photovoltaic (PV)},

DOI: 10.1109/STPEC49749.2020.9297794

This paper presents a novel curve scanning based Maximum Power Point Tracking (MPPT) algorithm for photovoltaic systems under Partial Shading Conditions (PSC). The proposed algorithm is designed to efficiently track both Global Maximum Power Point (GMPP) and Local Maximum Power Point (LMPP) under varying irradiance conditions, ensuring optimal energy extraction from PV systems.

Keywords: Photovoltaic systems, MPPT, DC-DC converters, Classification algorithms, Tracking loops, Global Maximum Power Point (GMPP), Partial Shading Condition (PSC)

Projects

Operations and Maintenance of Offshore Wind Turbines (Innovation Lab)

Fraunhofer x Femtec
Contributing to the Operation and Maintenance work package at Fraunhofer's Femtec Innovation Lab, leveraging satellite and AI technologies to enhance predictive maintenance of offshore wind turbines.

Supervisor: Julia Walgern (Group Manager Technical Reliability)

March 2025 - July 2025

Research Project on MRI motion artifact detection using Self supervised Contrastive learning

Universität Stuttgart x Universitätsklinikum Tübingen
Research project on deep learning-based motion artifact detection and segmentation in brain MRI images using selfsupervised contrastive learning. The approach employs a modified Swin UNet architecture integrated with pretext tasks to improve artifact detection and segmentation, enhancing the reliability and accuracy of brain MRI diagnostics

Examiner and Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Bin Yang, Veronica Ecker MSc.

December 2024 - May 2025

Maximum Power Point Tracking based Charge Controller (Bachelor Thesis)

National Institute of Technology (NIT), Silchar, India
Based on the Curve Scanning MPPT Algorithm under Partial shading conditions (PSC) to optimise the power extraction from PV panels for variable loads at Global Maximum Power Point (GMPP).

Examiner and Supervisor: Dr. Amritesh Kumar

Feb 2019 - Feb 2020

Interests

When I’m not exploring the world of deep learning or working on cool tech projects, I enjoy unwinding with Netflix thrillers, going on short walks to clear my head, and discovering new music. I love experiencing different cultures, whether it’s through travel, exchange semesters, or just chatting with people from around the world. I’m also a big fan of writing and often share bits of my academic and personal journey online. Balance is important to me, I believe in working hard, staying curious, and making space for the little joys in life.
